headline: IBM nears roughly $11 billion deal for Confluent, WSJ reports
summary: IBM is in advanced ​talks to acquire ‌data infrastructure company Confluent for ‌about $11 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing ⁠people familiar ‌with the matter. The deal could be ‍announced as soon as Monday, according to the ​report. Confluent has a ‌market capitalization of about $8.09 billion, as per LSEG-compiled data.

The deal could be ‍announced as soon as Monday, according to the ​report. Confluent has a ‌market capitalization of about $8.09 billion, as per LSEG-compiled data.

headline: IBM Nears Roughly $11 Billion Deal for Confluent
summary: A deal could be announced as soon as Monday, the people said, cautioning that the talks could still fall apart.  Confluent provides technology that helps manage streams of real-time data used in big artificial-intelligence models.  An acquisition of Confluent would be the biggest deal for IBM in recent memory as it repositions its business around AI.

An acquisition of Confluent would be the biggest deal for IBM in recent memory as it repositions its business around AI.

headline: Riyadh Air and IBM Partner to Launch World's First AI-Native Airline
summary: At IBM Think Riyadh 2025, IBM (NYSE: IBM) and Riyadh Air announced a major milestone in their collaboration, unveiling Riyadh Air as the world's first AI-native airline. Designed from the ground up without legacy patch work, these AI-driven operations provide the foundation to transform guest and employee experiences and set a new benchmark for innovation in the aviation industry.

headline: IBM nears $11 billion Confluent deal to boost cloud push, WSJ reports
summary: IBM is in advanced talks to acquire data-infrastructure company Confluent for about $11 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on ​Sunday, in a move aimed at boosting Big Blue's ability ‌to capture growing demand for cloud services. The deal for Confluent, an open-source platform used to process ‌massive streams of real-time data - from bank transactions to website clicks - could be announced as early as Monday, the newspaper reported, citing unnamed sources. Reuters could not immediately verify the WSJ report.

content.summary: IBM is in advanced talks to acquire data-infrastructure company Confluent for about $11 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on ​Sunday, in a move aimed at boosting Big Blue's ability ‌to capture growing demand for cloud services. The deal for Confluent, an open-source platform used to process ‌massive streams of real-time data - from bank transactions to website clicks - could be announced as early as Monday, the newspaper reported, citing unnamed sources. Reuters could not immediately verify the WSJ report.

headline: IBM boosts cloud computing push with $11 billion Confluent deal
summary: IBM said on Monday it will buy data infrastructure company ​Confluent in a deal valued at $11 billion, ‌ramping up its cloud-computing offerings to capitalize on an ‌AI-driven demand boom.  Big Blue's shares fell more than 2% in premarket trading.  The offer price of $31 per share represents an about 50% premium ⁠to Confluent's closing ‌price of $20.73 on October 7 - the last trading session before Reuters first ‍reported its exploration of a sale after attracting acquisition interest.

content.title: IBM boosts cloud computing push with $11 billion Confluent deal
content.summary: IBM said on Monday it will buy data infrastructure company ​Confluent in a deal valued at $11 billion, ‌ramping up its cloud-computing offerings to capitalize on an ‌AI-driven demand boom.  Big Blue's shares fell more than 2% in premarket trading.  The offer price of $31 per share represents an about 50% premium ⁠to Confluent's closing ‌price of $20.73 on October 7 - the last trading session before Reuters first ‍reported its exploration of a sale after attracting acquisition interest.

headline: IBM buys data streaming platform Confluent in $11 billion deal
summary: IBM said Monday it's buying data streaming platform Confluent in a deal worth $11 billion that will help bolster the technology company's artificial intelligence strategy.  The two companies said they signed a “definitive agreement” for IBM to acquire all of Confluent Inc.'s issued and outstanding common stock for $31 per share in cash, which represents an enterprise value of $11 billion.  Confluent, based in Mountain View, Calif., is an open source data streaming platform that “connects, processes and governs" data and events in real time, the companies said in a joint statement.

content.title: IBM buys data streaming platform Confluent in $11 billion deal
content.summary: IBM said Monday it's buying data streaming platform Confluent in a deal worth $11 billion that will help bolster the technology company's artificial intelligence strategy.  The two companies said they signed a “definitive agreement” for IBM to acquire all of Confluent Inc.'s issued and outstanding common stock for $31 per share in cash, which represents an enterprise value of $11 billion.  Confluent, based in Mountain View, Calif., is an open source data streaming platform that “connects, processes and governs" data and events in real time, the companies said in a joint statement.

thumbnail.caption: FILE - The logo for IBM appears above a trading post on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange, March 18, 2019. (AP Photo/Richard Drew, File)

headline: Confluent Stock Soars. IBM to Acquire the AI Infrastructure Company for $11 Billion.
summary: Confluent  stock surged Monday after  International Business Machines  agreed to buy the data-infrastructure company in a deal for $11 billion.  In a press release, IBM said it would acquire all of Confluent’s issued and outstanding common shares for $31 a share, representing an enterprise value of $11 billion.  The transaction is expected to close by the middle of 2026, subject to approval by Confluent shareholders, who hold roughly 62% of of the voting power of Confluent’s outstanding common stock.

content.title: Confluent Stock Soars. IBM to Acquire the AI Infrastructure Company for $11 Billion.
content.summary: Confluent  stock surged Monday after  International Business Machines  agreed to buy the data-infrastructure company in a deal for $11 billion.  In a press release, IBM said it would acquire all of Confluent’s issued and outstanding common shares for $31 a share, representing an enterprise value of $11 billion.  The transaction is expected to close by the middle of 2026, subject to approval by Confluent shareholders, who hold roughly 62% of of the voting power of Confluent’s outstanding common stock.

headline: IBM accelerates cloud drive with $11 billion Confluent deal as AI demand booms
summary: IBM said on Monday it will buy data infrastructure company Confluent in a deal valued at $11 billion, ramping ​up its cloud-computing offerings to capitalize on an AI-driven demand boom.  Big ‌Blue, under CEO Arvind Krishna, has doubled down on M&As to beef up its cloud ‌and software business - a high-growth, high-margin area - as customers invest to upgrade their digital infrastructure to house complex artificial intelligence applications.  Mountain View, California-based Confluent provides technology needed to manage massive, real-time data streams for artificial intelligence models.

content.title: IBM accelerates cloud drive with $11 billion Confluent deal as AI demand booms
content.summary: IBM said on Monday it will buy data infrastructure company Confluent in a deal valued at $11 billion, ramping ​up its cloud-computing offerings to capitalize on an AI-driven demand boom.  Big ‌Blue, under CEO Arvind Krishna, has doubled down on M&As to beef up its cloud ‌and software business - a high-growth, high-margin area - as customers invest to upgrade their digital infrastructure to house complex artificial intelligence applications.  Mountain View, California-based Confluent provides technology needed to manage massive, real-time data streams for artificial intelligence models.

Paramount Skydance (PSKY) announced an all-cash offer to buy Warner Bros. (WBD), countering the recently announced Netflix (NFLX) deal. Morgan Stanley analysts downgraded Tesla (TSLA). Morgan Stanley analysts downgraded Tesla (TSLA).

headline: Confluent Stock Soars on  IBM Acquisition. Why IBM Is Making the Deal.
summary: Confluent  stock surged Monday after  International Business Machines  agreed to buy the data-infrastructure company in a deal for $11 billion.  In a press release, IBM said it would acquire all of Confluent’s issued and outstanding common shares for $31 a share, representing an enterprise value of $11 billion.  Confluent stock jumped 29% to $29.78, putting them on pace for their largest same-day percent increase since a 34% jump in February 2024, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

content.title: Confluent Stock Soars on  IBM Acquisition. Why IBM Is Making the Deal.
content.summary: Confluent  stock surged Monday after  International Business Machines  agreed to buy the data-infrastructure company in a deal for $11 billion.  In a press release, IBM said it would acquire all of Confluent’s issued and outstanding common shares for $31 a share, representing an enterprise value of $11 billion.  Confluent stock jumped 29% to $29.78, putting them on pace for their largest same-day percent increase since a 34% jump in February 2024, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: IBM To Buy Confluent For $9.3B To Expand AI Services
summary: IBM is buying the data-streaming platform Confluent for about $9.3 billion, marking one of its largest takeovers yet and a major bet on the kind of enterprise software that artificial intelligence tools need to perform tasks in real time. Bloomberg's US Deals Managing Editor Liana Baker on "Bloomberg Markets" with Scarlet Fu.
